item.description:
This hike will explore some of the lesser used areas of the forest. The hike will traverse through three frost pockets and will be a chance to see the different habitat in these sculptured hollows.   The hike will then continue back onto fire roads and a chance to view where some controlled burns have taken place.  Fire is a natural cycle of pine barrens and this is is a chance to see how the forest recovers and thrives where fire has taken place. The hike is approximately 4 1/2 miles.

Dogs are welcome but please be considerate of other hikers, especially where paths are narrow.  Meet at 12:45 for 1PM start.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Friends of Myles Standish September Hike of the Month
